content.question: Which of the following is the best conclusion that can be drawn from the data in the table?

choices.label: Support for the Vietnam War led Congress to hold more hearings to discuss increases in expenditures on the military effort.
Public concern over the Vietnam War led Congress to hold more hearings to consider using the power of the purse to influence the conduct of the war.
The public reaction to the September 11 terrorist attacks led to many hearings to limit federal expenditures to fight terrorism.
The number of hearings have increased in the House of Representatives because members have become more dependent on political action committees.

content.answer: Public concern over the Vietnam War led Congress to hold more hearings to consider using the power of the purse to influence the conduct of the war.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
